review: This is simply a terrible device.  Unlike Apple TV and streaming from my computer or phone, the Fire TV constantly pauses itself, sometimes literally 3 or 4 times per minute.  We give up and continue watching from the computer and it works perfectly, so it is not our internet connection.  I tested by streaming Netflix on both Apple TV and Fire one right after the other -- Apple TV was fine and Fire kept pausing.  Very disappointing, and a waste of money.
author: Robert L. Plotz "Robert"

review: Fire TV is a polished and powerful streaming solution.  I have both a Fire and an Apple TV and in my experience the Fire is a superior device:Fast:  The UI responds quickly and content loads as lightning speed with ASAP.  I am using Fire over Wi-Fi and have no content quality issues or load time issues.  Works perfectly.Voice Search:  Voice Search is great and highly accurate.  It recognizes input the first time and in my use has been quite accurate.  I have not tested it with a lot of background noise but so far this voice recognition system is the best I've used.Prime:  If you have Prime this device is a no brainer.  Get access to tons of content (audio and video) at no additional charge.Easy to use:  While the Apple TV still has the upper hand here, I found it quite simple to add "channels" that I want.I would have given it a confident 5 stars but there are a few components missing:HBO Go:  I understand this is in the works but until it arrives it will be missing key content that I can get and use frequently on my Apple TV.iOS Control App:  While this is less important to me, it would be great to have the same options that Fire Phone and Android users have.Bottom line - If you are looking for a streaming device and you are already in or want to get into the Amazon ecosystem this device won't let you down.
